definition: radical of a Chinese character
ministry/department/section/part/division/troops/board/classifier for works of literature, films, machines etc
head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
dictionary arrangement of Chinese characters under radicals

sentences.english: Do you know the radical of this word?
sentences.chinese: 你知道这个字的偏旁部首吗？

sentences.english: The last two strokes are reversed for being radical or independent Hanzi.
sentences.chinese: 最后两笔当作为部首和独立汉字时书写顺序相反。

sentences.english: Convenient location of characters through either phonetic or radical reference 4.
sentences.chinese: 采用拼音检字法和部首检字法两种，方便易查。

sentences.english: Analyzing ideographic nature of radical is meaningful.
sentences.chinese: 分析部首表意性是有意义的。

sentences.english: Write the Chinese characters with following radicals.
sentences.chinese: 写出带有下列偏旁部首的字。

sentences.english: In the present Chinese characters teaching, the radicals' appellations cause much confusion.
sentences.chinese: 目前的识字教学中，部首的名称较混乱。

sentences.english: One of the Nanjing-wide "Kai Li line radicals in control."
sentences.chinese: 宁一全的《楷隶行部首对照》。

definition: component of a Chinese character (as the radical or the phonetic part)
stroke count (number of brushstrokes of a Chinese character)
phono-semantic compound character
single-component character
semantic component of a phono-semantic character (e.g. component刂[dao1] in 刻[ke4])
variant Chinese character
stroke order (when writing Chinese character)
"lid" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 8)
name of "water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85)/see also 氵[shui3]
(colloquial) grapheme 攵 (variant form of Kangxi radical 66, 攴)
to walk (side part of split character)
look-up method for Chinese characters
combined ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character that combines the meanings of existing elements/also known as joint ideogram or associative compounds
ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character indicating an idea, such as up and down/also known as self-explanatory character
pictogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character derived from a picture/sometimes called hieroglyph
phonetic component of Chinese character
